name: Jamsa
body:
### What's Jamsa?
Jamsa Project is a blind helper system that aims to allow blind people being more aware of their environment. To achive this we have developed a smart glove that interacts with RFID tags.

The glove communicates with an Android device [jamsa-mobile](https://github.com/jamsa-project/jamsa-mobile) that requests the tag information to a server [jamsa-server](https://github.com/jamsa-project/jamsa-server) and executes an action.

### Motivation
It is already the XXI century and blind people still **only** uses a white cane to know their environment. The technology already exists so we only have to put everything together.

### Components
We have used:
* ID-20LA RFID sensor. RFID sensor with integrated antenna.
 * https://www.sparkfun.com/products/11828
* SEN-09963. USB towith FTDI chip
 * https://www.sparkfun.com/products/9963
* Mobile device (any Android device with 3.1 or higher will do it).
 * Theses have been used for testing: Samung Galaxy S3/Samsung Galaxy Nexus/Nexus 5
* OTG Cable
* Gloves :)
* Linux server with a [REST API](https://github.com/jamsa-project/jamsa-server) developed in perl and the web framework [Dancer](http://www.perldancer.org/).
